clinical_study.brief_title: Transitional Care Interventions for Patients With Cirrhosis Post-TIPS

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators conducted a randomized controlled trial to describe if multidisciplinary and patient-centered transitional care interventions for patients with cirrhosis post-TIPS can improve compliance behavior and reduce complications post-TIPS after discharge.

primary_outcome.measure: The compliance behavior associated with complications post-TIPS
primary_outcome.description: It was surveyed using a self-designed questionnaire based on evidence. The questionnaire includes 6 items that address taking medicine on time, quality low-protein diet intake, going to sleep at a regular time, moderate exercise, emotion regulation, regular follow-up. Item responses are on a 4-point scale (0 = never to 3 = always). Data were collected by face-to-face interviews with trained transition nurses. Change is being assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of adverse events (shunt dysfunction and hepatic encephalopathy)

arm_group.description: The conventional care was performed for the patients of control group

intervention.description: Continuous nursing through telephone follow-up, family visits, and WeChat guided patients to prevent gastrointestinal bleeding, infection and constipation ,intake quality low-protein diet, recognize minimal encephalopathy, monitor blood ammonia, return visit regularly, deal with adverse drug reactions of anticoagulant.
